channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Surge AI, the Hot Tech Startup You’ve Probably Never Heard of, Is Already Outpacing Rivals
item.description: The data-labeling firm founded by Edwin Chen is reportedly pulling in more revenue than Scale AI despite being mostly bootstrapped.

item.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says AI can rival someone with a PhD—just weeks after saying it’s ready for entry-level jobs. So what’s left for grads?
item.description: As Amazon, OpenAI and Anthropic bosses warn, entry-level corporate jobs are about to get cut, experts say Gen Z don’t need to panic—yet.

item.title: Billionaire Telegram founder leaves his $14 billion fortune to the 100+ children he’s fathered—which means $132 million for each lucky Gen Alpha kid

item.title: What Meta’s Efforts to Poach Top Talent Can Teach You About Crashing Tough Markets
item.description: Meta’s tactics are aggressive, and require deep pockets. Whether its pricey recruiting will make it an AI leader is still unclear.

item.title: 5 Ways to Optimize Growth Without Giving Up Equity
item.description: Taking on debt or raising capital aren’t the only ways to grow a business.

item.title: Weight-loss drugs should be first step to prevent heart disease, top cardiology group says
item.description: Millions more Americans should be taking weight-loss drugs to prevent heart disease, according to the American College of Cardiology.

item.title: Dallas Cowboys cheerleaders have more reason to cheer: They’re getting a 400% pay increase

item.title: Trump’s ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’ Could Pull the Plug on a Lot of Clean Energy
